website_summaries.verdict: This WiFi extender is the perfect choice for large homes that want full WiFi coverage without sacrificing any speed.
pros: Dual-band extender prevents reduction in speed
Powerful WiFi extender that works even through several walls
cons: If you're not tech-savvy, you may find the installation to be a little challenging

customer_reviews.title: Started great, ended as fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: Received this in December 2017. Was an easy install for anyone who has had any experience setting up a router. And it worked great as advertised. I did not have drops like a lot of people reported. Unfortunately what I did have in July 2018 after 7ish months of use was a burning smell coming from it. As you can see from the picture, the unit was starting to burn up and melt down. I have used the wall outlet it was on for various things, and have never had an issue. The item was plugged in appropriately and never removed or messed with. This could have burnt my house down.
customer_reviews.author: ROB

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to see here...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible wifi extender. I am a systems administrator by trade, and either the one I received was defective, or this product simply doesn't work. The primary thing to keep in mind is this is not a MESH network. (Meaning one SSID and seamless connectivity) You have to set up a second SSID for it to even slightly work. Even then it's hit or miss with its coverage and constantly drops off. I would not recommend this product, instead, I would go with the Mesh X6S. Also to add, I attempted to set up as a single SSID with my existing wifi, and could not get it to route to the internet. (Its supposed to support this configuration)
customer_reviews.author: TheBDP

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to replace a Netgear Extender AC750. The AC750 was easy to install. I tried for two days to install the EX6120, tried everything. I called customer support, waited 45 mins to speak to someone. When connected, I was referred to a technician, another 10 min wait. After connecting to a technician, he asked me for my phone number in case we were disconnected. Five mins later we were disconnected. He never called back as he said he would. Today I called customer service again, was disconnected before speaking to anyone. Go with another company that has better customer service.
customer_reviews.author: John Pomponio

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst wifi extender
customer_reviews.text: The product came in perfect cosmetic condition even the packaging wasn't damaged. After following the instruction online and setting up the EX6120 I started testing the wifi speed. First in the same location as the router then on the ground floor of a 1700 sqft house. The speed decreased and I was okay with the speed on the lower level but the wifi reliability was terrible. Signal dropped every 5 minutes. This was only used to connect two devices even then it couldn't handle the load. I tried running an ethernet cable and still did not make any difference. THerefor I would not recommend this product if your house is larger than 1500sqft.
customer_reviews.author: Akshar

customer_reviews.title: Ease of set-up for anyone
customer_reviews.text: Clear and simple set-up instructions make the EX 6120 a breeze to mate with your router. Note: be patient when watching for the "green indication lights" on the unit as it connects to your router. In my case, I worried that the green positive connection lights did not come on quickly - thought my router was not communicating with it. It may take a couple of minutes for both router and extender to link up, but it will. No tech support required. The EX6120 extender is installed at the other end of our home and wifi signal strength is great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Plater

customer_reviews.title: Terrible device
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst electronic device I’ve purchased in years. I’ve finally decided to write a review after recently trying to see if I could update the firmware to make this extender work as advertised. I can not. In a nutshell, it’s Impossible to reliably log onto the set up menus, it simply will not work with the 5G channel, on 2.4 G the speed is 1/2 of router’s, no tech support after 90 days (other companies like TP-Link have up to 2 year suport), impossible to connect to server to do a firmware update. In the trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a signal boosting MONSTER.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a signal boosting MONSTER. The primary node for our house is 80' from my workstations, etc. Now I'm on a POWERFUL, no hassles to the house router. It just needed the ssid + key, and gave me two extended SSID's for my "enhanced network" ... damn easy! It broadcasts on both the AC 5ghz and B-N+ 2.4ghz bands. very flexible. I didn't mess with channel preferences, but I'm sure it's in there. Sorry for all the geek, geeks will understand. I'm a 27yr+ IT Systems & Network Engineer. This was cake compared to setting up a BGP connection. ahhch a royal PIA. LOL
customer_reviews.author: joel huebner

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far.
customer_reviews.text: Works as it is supposed to. I use it upstairs to connect my TV box to the ethernet on this extender. Somehow the hardware update function on the logon webpage hasn't been working and I have to manually download and save the update on the PC first then manually update it. Hope they can fix it. Don't forget to turn off the WPS on this thing. Worth the 50 dollars. **update 4/26/2017** It appears that they fixed the hardware update function on the logon webpage. It's working!!
customer_reviews.author: Totoro

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. I’m using it to make an aquarium controller wireless (Neptune Apex). The set up and installation is fast and easy. I will say that one of the antennas won’t stay up on its own but that hasn’t effected performance. I was having a bit of signal issues in the beginning but I found that to be the fault of my Verizon Fios router (which needed to be replaced) this is great and works well. I recommend this if you need to make a WiFi signal stronger or need to make a device wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: led light on front dont work properly
customer_reviews.text: this unit was easy to install.... but the led lights on the front of the unit dont work properly.....on the router led on the front does not work right...... its always red....... i have used a wifi signal meter by the extender and it reads 100 percent but the light on the extender show red...which means a very poor signal.... no big deal. the extender works but. why put a so call signal indicator on the unit if it isnt going to work right....
customer_reviews.author: F. E. Belluso

customer_reviews.title: the setup was easy. It synced up with the router (also a ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this with high hopes. We have a two-story house, router upstairs and just OK wi-fi downstairs. So I wasn't getting this to put in a dead zone a mile away with unrealistic expectations. Rather, I just wanted a boost. That seemed reasonable. Well, the setup was easy. It synced up with the router (also a Netgear product) and connected with green lights all the way around. Awesome! But then, for no reason, the router connection gets worse and it displays a yellow light instead of red. Then red. Then randomly it will switch back to green. So I don't know, maybe I just got a bad one and I should send it back. Either way I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but it was disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I i’m fairly skilled with technology and use it a lot for my work. needed something to extend the Internet out to my patio since I have to do a lot of work from home under our current Covid situation. I don’t mean to say anything negative, but I followed the instructions carefully. I had to reinstall it two three or four times to get it to work, and it barely worked once in a while. I contacted the tech department. They were very helpful. I did everything they suggested and it just didn’t work. I gave up, bought a T-P Link for a similar price, had a working in five minutes and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Zorro

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. In my house the main router is upstairs in my office. For some reason the signal in the master bedroom (which is on the main floor) gets horrible signal. I have normally in the office 300-500 mbps but that would drop down to 2-5 mbps in the master bedroom. We installed this extender in about 10 mins and now I am getting over 100 mbps in the bedroom and even out in the backyard. This thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: Joel D

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do the trick for us
customer_reviews.text: Got this to enhance our ridiculously poor signal on our gig internet from xfinity. Placed this in the next bedroom over from the router, roughly 20 feet away and through 1 wall. Picked up the signal. Hardwired to computer with cat6 to the Ethernet port on this adapter. Got 100mb down. That’s the best it can do. We’ve tried both the 2 and 5ghz signals. They are both spotty on WiFi and not as reliable as the weak original router signal. Which throws our gig speed into the trash 30 feet away, where we get 20mb down. How does xfinity make such a horribly weak router in 2020? Must have tried hard. Still not buying their pods.
customer_reviews.author: pulsev2

customer_reviews.title: A waste of time and money, but cats find it interesting.
customer_reviews.text: Wifi password never worked for the _2GEXT signal, even though it's supposed to be the same password as my wifi. I tried alternates to the password, everything I could think of. Customer support was no help, and have tried setup about 5 times now. Then, I switched to using the plug-in feature for the television. That worked for about 2 months, then would oscillate between being connected to the tv and not connected to the tv...sometimes 10 times within a minute. Very frustrating. A piece of junk that was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Saenz

customer_reviews.title: Antennas are flimsy, rinky dink quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just over a year ago and have rarely adjusted the antennas or even had a reason to but they are flimsily attached and cannot be tightened. One of them is very loose. The connection quality is OK. When you extend both 2.4 and 5GHz networks, it uses only the 5GHz band to extend both frequencies, meaning the extender connects to the router only at 5GHz and then creates the 2.4GHz extension off the 5GHz, so both frequencies are actually extensions of the router's 5GHz band. That's not really too much of a problem but it adds extra load to the 5 instead of leveraging the 2.4. Maybe it's just a performance limitation in the product's engineering.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vinson

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on my screened porch to extend my wifi to the backyard. I'm using an Apple Airport router and had the hardest time setting up this device. I followed the instructions and connected it to the router, but then couldn't connect any devices. It took a lot of internet searching, but found instructions to connect my laptop directly to the extender and set it up online. None of the instructions provided with the device worked. I almost returned the device, but will keep it. If the signal isn't as good as it should be, I'll report back.
customer_reviews.author: kld311

customer_reviews.title: Does not pass through 5Ghz Internet for many, many people
customer_reviews.text: There are numerous reported issues on Netgear's "Community", which is pretty much the only tech support you get. Everyone one of them says the same thing, "Works great for the 2.4Ghz, but will not pass through internet on the 5ghz." Which means, this is useless as a dual-band extender. Might as well save your money and get a really good 2.4Ghz only. My setup is a Netgear Nighthawk router (a newer one as of 2020) and their own extender won't work with it. Save your money and don't buy this if you expect to pass through 5Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Dobeman

customer_reviews.title: Little maintenance is required once it is setup and installed.
customer_reviews.text: I have used many access points, range extenders in my career and I will have to say, NetGear makes the better one these days. I replaced all my TP-link range extenders in the past couple of years with the AC1200, as its a good unit. I have also installed the AC1200 into several family/friends homes to boost their home networks. They ask me with device to purchase, I told them to get the AC1200 and I will setup and install. I like the fact that these units tend to be maintenance free, once I setup, spec and install, the most that the users have to do is unplug and plug back in to reset the device.
customer_reviews.author: Spyke

customer_reviews.title: Its Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: It works fine.Easy setup and pretty good signal strength, although I wish it were better. I have it setup on my second floor to extend the signal strength to our TV in our game room. I initially had it in the game room but the signal to the extender was weak, so I moved it to the room directly above where my modem/wifi is located. The signal to the extender is good however the signal to FireTV stick is only fair to good. It has never been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Did we get a used one?
customer_reviews.text: The initial set up seemed easy enough and we were supposed to get a new router extender name and create a password? Instead we get an existing router name " Lenny_2GEXT and Lenny_ 5GEXT"and we do not have that password ! This unit is no good to use unless we can access the password. Waste of our time in getting it , setting up and now more time to return it and reorder a new router extender, def not this one or seller again. p/s Once we reset, it worked. No super great coverage but improved , definitely. Nice to know that we bought a used one.
customer_reviews.author: daMetswife

customer_reviews.title: Fraud warning!  DO NOT PURCHASE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!! Nothing about this product is positive! Tech support is in India, unable to understand their ‘English’. Tech Support EXTREMELY rude, we then asked for management, which was even worse! They asked us for private information and a desktop computer where they could ghost in and reset everything for us!!! Unbelievable! We are absolutely not willing to share ANY private information with anyone, especially persons foreign countries. We would only be asking to be hacked. Cyber security should be taken seriously these days. We are returning for a complete refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated about getting a WiFi extender. I’d never had one, didn’t know if they’d really work. But I live in a two story house and the TV furthest away from the router had a weak Wifi signal, only registering as Fair, and a lot of buffering. I finally decided to try an extender but I wanted a name brand at a decent price. I found this NETGEAR extender and was able to buy a used one on Amazon, so I got it at half price. It was super easy to set up, only took minutes, and the wifi signal immediately jumped to Excellent on every device throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I tried all sorts of troubleshooting with tech support. Hardwiring the extender did not work either. Even when hardwired, the wifi it would put out was still a weaker signal than the router 60 feet away. Your better off buying a 100ft ethernet chord than wasting time and money on this. I returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how much it really boosts the signal
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I had to give this a 3 star rating because I am not sure how well it works. There are so many variables when it comes to Wi-Fi as I have come to learn and many things can affect the signal. it seemed to work good at first but then our streaming video started to buffer again and said it was a weak signal on our roku devices.
customer_reviews.author: JDan the Amazon man

customer_reviews.title: Will buy it again
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning of the install it was a little confusing and after about 1 hour of trying, I gave up. I came back the next day ready to return it and BAM!!! It connects. I really dont know what I did the day before but it worked. My in laws have a camper in my back yard and the love the extended WIFI that they are receiving. ( Now if can only get them to split the cost would be awsome ). I bought a second one for my garage for my personal music steaming and internet and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Louie T. Sr

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: This device is a great help on extending the wifi in our back two bedrooms upstairs. One is now a work from home office and we were always having issues with the lap top disconecting from the wifi. This extender has stopped that and made the signal stronger. Easy to install and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Covid - 19: Bad time to need service. The item worked fine, never great, just fine, and then it stopped working. I contacted their customer service and was told I was two days outside of their support team and if I paid for tech support they would help me. I tried to contact Amazon as this item should still be under the manufacturer's warranty, but because of Covid, I was unable to reach anyone. Unfortunately, I purchased with my Amazon credit card and not with Visa, so I'm unsure if I will get my money back :-(. Please note, set-up took forever and became very stressful even after the use of YouTube videos.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Does not reach far.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't not provide much range. I have installed in kitchen, I go outside on back patio and loos two bars on signal strength. About twenty five feet away and signal drops quit a bit going outside. Wanted to provide coverage into back yard but a fail. It only reaches about thirty feet into back yard on a outside wall in back of house. Inside house the same, barely any coverage on opposite side of house which is single story home about 1200 square feet of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny B

customer_reviews.title: Better than not having it!
customer_reviews.text: The WIFI extender works great. We live in a two-story concrete house (keeps the typhoons out) with the router downstairs and the WIFI has never been very good upstairs (surfing the internet, downloading, uploading, streaming, etc). We have only had the extender for about a week and no complaints so far, internet signal upstairs is WAAAAAY better than it was!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very frequently drops signal
customer_reviews.text: The device is fairly easy to install and does give a fairly good range extension. The problem with it though is that it quite frequently just drops the signal. You will be using a device and you just see that you are not connected to the internet. Sometimes this happens two or three times in an hour. Sometimes it resumes automatically but other times you have to go and reestablish the connection manually. Annoying Have not checked tech support on the matter.
customer_reviews.author: NOSREME

customer_reviews.title: What a POS. Headaches, works for a bit then you have to reset and redo it.
customer_reviews.text: initially works. Then odd stuff happens like the 5G will work but not the 2G. Vice Versa, then straight up tells you the password or key you have used for the last 5 days is suddenly not correct. F this little thing and anything NETGEAR makes. I knew better.. I just came back two months later and wanted to say this is still a piece of crap. When I called support, they tried to sell me antivirus instead of fixing the connection.. no joke.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. I bought one of these a few years ago from NETGEARS website and had full WiFi 150ft away from my house. I bought this one on amazon and it does not enhance the WiFi or extend it at all. I ran a speed test under this WiFi extender and it came up as error multiple times finally these are the best numbers i got on the speed test. If anything this is slowing down and interfering with my main WiFi connection. Buy something better!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex R

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue installing
customer_reviews.text: First, they don't just extend your existing wifi network. They create new ones that your device is supposed to automatically hop to if that's a better signal. We bought 2 of these so it added 4 new networks to all the devices in our house. Then nothing would change from one network to another. I called tech support and the guy hung up on me after a few minutes. Next time two times I called, they put me on hold until I hung up. Bye. Got other ones through my ISP and they installed in under 5 minutes using just my single wifi network. Far superior.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Kept loosing signal
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine when it worked. Problem is it kept loosing the signal to my devices. Set up was not too hard, but not easy either. I went to the Netgear site for help. First step, get the most recent updates. Did that and no help. Next step reset. Did that and it didn't help. The only thing that worked was to disconnect it from my device then re-connect. That worked for awhile then it would drop out again. Frustrated and tired, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: W. D. Modisette

customer_reviews.title: Great device.
customer_reviews.text: I have 15 devices without issues any more I start having a slow down. I have various wireless devices laptop, iPad, cell, printer, outdoor security cameras, I have extender placed in center of house which is approx 31’ away from router, I can get WiFi out to my pool deck area now which is over 35’ away from router - extender is next to window overlooking deck. Wifi now reaches all security cameras outside and cell. All devices work well up to 15.
customer_reviews.author: Knappny

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Works great. I have a new xfinity router but didn’t reach the upstairs kids rooms that well (one not at all). Got this today. Followed the simple WPS connection steps. Worked like a charm. Both kids now have 3 bars and speed test results around 60 MPS download and almost 40 upload. I was hesitant but I needed to try something and this works well. It creates a new network name (your current network with _EXT added) which enables you to connect to your router. If you want to have the same network name through the house, then you need to try a mesh network which is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working by 18 months...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this January of 2019 and it worked ok, but for the last couple of months the right antenna keeps flopping down, it will not stay vertical and the device constantly drops out of sync and red lights until you jiggle it, then it works fine for an hour or two before dropping again. Have reset it and resynced it dozens of times over the last couple of months and am ready to toss it at this point. It was never great but now it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: HuntGod

customer_reviews.title: Worked only 2 feet away from the router
customer_reviews.text: As it was suggested in set up notes is to plug the unit in close to the router, so I did it literality within 2 feet of the router. It worked great, but none of the settings are kept if the unit disconnects from the power or restarted. So after moving where I know the signal from my router is still strong, but about 10 feet away from it, this unit wouldn't be able to connect at all. I tried moving it back where I plugged it in earlier, but nothing worked. Luckily, the return was simple.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davydenko

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with getting wifi access in my basement, living room, and upstairs guest room and decided to give this a try. I was not disappointed. PROS Easy setup, the WPS link steps were all I needed to get up and running. Everyone noticed the increased coverage immediately. CONS nothing to write home about, but each device add a "_2GEXT" or "_5GEXT" to the SSID it is extending. I have 2 in play, so I have a network that's labeled SSID_2GEXT_2GEXT. They all work but would be nice if a user could edit the name to differentiate them - so I'd have something like SSID_BasementEXT.
customer_reviews.author: NORBIUS

customer_reviews.title: specs and installation oversimplified
customer_reviews.text: The great "they say" that it's easy. Maybe ... if you're; persistent, experienced, knowledgeable, etc. Unit overheated. Attached device(s) connections were dysfunctional past first layer, unstable, and overheated. After much trial, error, fails, online inquiry, and more than a little luck, I finally learned that this unit does not work happily as a dual band on a fully turned-up tri-band router. The big win came when I completely software disabled the 5GHz band on this extender. I could have saved some dollars and grief by just getting a single channel extender.
customer_reviews.author: Nun Chuckie

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: My son kept telling me we needed to get one of these for downstairs, I kept complaining about the lag. I was skeptical it would help. I'm glad I finally bought one and tried it because it does help me get a better signal downstairs. - We have Cox 300 Mbps and my son is plugged in directly to the router upstairs since he does online high school. Since we bought this, it's rare that a movie or Netflix buffers like it was doing frequently before I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: LTay

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection
customer_reviews.text: This extender appeared to work excellent while setting it up. I needed a wired connection in our bedroom to connect an Arlo base station. After about 30 Minutes, it would drop the connection to the internet! It would sometimes reconnect itself, which makes me think it had an overheating problem. Moving it closer to the router made no difference. I messed with this thing for two days! No Luck!! I returned it, and bought a TP-Link M5 Mesh system, and replaced my R7500 Netgear router that I bought in 2015, and Netgear no longer supports! Smartest thing I ever did! Had it setup and working perfectly after about 30 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Fashely

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Very Solid Prodict.
customer_reviews.text: This wireless extender worked out great. I have been attempting to solve the issue I had with trying to connect two of my wireless security cameras that are located in dead zones and have been as such, unreliable. I had considered hiring an electrician to run Ethernet to each one on the cameras but that would have have run into hundreds of dollars to do so. After I had set up the wireless extender, the performance of the security cameras has greatly improved. Is the performance equivalent to a wired connection? Absolutely not but for around $40 dollars, it is extremely solid and a heck of a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Skywalker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't even get it to connect to my WiFi. Every time I tried to set mine up as a WiFi Range Extender it disconnects itself from my computer. I had to reset this product three times and I still couldn't get it to stop disconnecting. The customer service for Netgear is also terrible. No chat, only available via phone. I had to wait 30+ minutes for someone to pick up the phone. Don't waste your money on this product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: welp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I had another wifi extender and it was such a pain to install and to reinstall everytime our wifi gave out. It was very difficult and finally stopped functioning altogether. When it was time to shop for another one, I dreaded the thought. Settled on NetGear after reading reviews and I was so pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to install. It has maintained the signal since the first day. When he wifi goes out it picks it back up on its own. Very good signal strength behind walls and closets at 150 ft.
customer_reviews.author: TinyForest

customer_reviews.title: Needed something to help boost connection
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this was to return, I'm pretty sure the person that bought this thought the same thing when they stuffed it into the box dirty and sent it back to be resold to me as new. I was looking for something to help boost up our internet for our cameras so they wouldn't be so glitchy, and they would be a little bit more reliable. Hopefully I'll be able to find something, too many people home now all using the same connection!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: An imperfect solution
customer_reviews.text: I had weak WiFi signal from a Cisco wireless router. I hoped this would solve the problem, but made things more confusing in terms of which WiFi I was connected to and was not a seamless experience from room to room. I had additional issues with the Cisco router when using this Netgear extender. Finally I had Comcast send me a new WIFI 6 Advanced router, and 6 xFi Pods. Solved.
customer_reviews.author: holyzoo

customer_reviews.title: Creates its own networks
customer_reviews.text: Creates its own networks (names) which are extensions of the Main router network - Apple devices don't always "see": each other on the same network and don't have instant synchronization Problem May be just interfacing with my Version FIOS router, which required initial set up this way. iPhone bars are definitely better than before, but nothing works as well as my old Airport Exprerss
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Will greatly reduce speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, as long as you're willing to be patient with the device. My biggest problem is it drops my 250mbs to maybe 20-25mbps down. Ping spikes between 60-250 randomly. I was expecting to lose some, but boy I was surprised to only get a tenth or less from my extender. I'm going to purchase an ethernet passover adapter, hopefully I can set this device up as an access point, otherwise it's basically worthless as only an extender.
customer_reviews.author: DavidMcAl

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect to router
customer_reviews.text: This model EX6120 is just the worse of the product anyone wishes to purchase. This product will connect to the router at all. I read all instructions did the resets all lights are green except the router link light that never came up at all. At this time of writing this review, I think it is time to return the product. Another thing, I have a Verizon g3100 router and it seems not compatible I guess.
customer_reviews.author: david Alemanjo

customer_reviews.title: Connected well to my router and laptop.
customer_reviews.text: My new Asus Computer would not connect solidly via wireless to my IP Provider's router either close or far away from the router. As a result, I purchased this extender under the assumption that it's electronics would connect without issue to the router and hence transmit that solid connection to my computer. My assumption was correct and now I not only have the convenience of an extender but also a solid connect to my IP. Thank you Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Climber

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with Motorola modem/router MT7711
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to extend the range of our Motorola modem/router MT7711. Unfortunately, this extender does not work well with this particular Motorola model. Although it connects easily, it slows down the internet speed so much so that not connecting to the router gets better wifi connection than connecting through the extender both right in front of the router and in the room that is farthest away from the router.
customer_reviews.author: Ajaxtelamona

customer_reviews.title: I was Skeptical at First
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about this, after reading a lot of the reviews, I purchased it. When I received it, I read the directions, very well worded, simple to follow. Before this, my WiFi signal was good in the farthest room. Now is shows Very Good. Ian very pleased with it so far. ( This is my own opinion, I was not giving anything in return for this)
customer_reviews.author: T S

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what it was suppose to do. It boosted my signal throughout the house. The dead spots I had are gone. Super easy to set up. Press a button on the unit while it is next to your router. Unplug it and move it to another room. Plug it into an outlet. Give it a few minutes. Once the LEDS are green you are good to go. I could see the change on my iphone immediately. I walked around my house without it being on and with it on. I could see the difference immediately. So far its a great product. No need to use my computer for setup.
customer_reviews.author: SGU111

customer_reviews.title: It works as described
customer_reviews.text: All good although for some reason I can only connect the extender either to the 2.4Ghz or the 5Ghz band, not both so I have decided to just connect it to the 5Ghz. Tried it on multiple devices (phone, laptop and tv) and seems to work fine. Overall satisfied. Serves it's purpose. I love the led lights that indicate whether the signal from the main router is reaching the extender well and whether the devices connected to the extender are receiving a good signal from it. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Belen Gutierrez Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Very poor WiFi--constant drops or not connected--wish I could return it!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use this product to extend WiFI in my home, but it proved useless. Set up was easy, but we had problems connecting and staying connected. I gave the solution a month, but in the end decided to use an eero mesh system to solve our WiFi coverage challenges. Unfortunately, I gave the product 30 days to see if it would improve and thus missed the return window, which expired a few days ago. Very disappointed and I would NOT recommend this product for anyone trying to extend coverage in their home and keep devices connected.
customer_reviews.author: ANNMARIE BROGAN

customer_reviews.title: Works Great But ...
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions three times and had a heck of a time trying to understand the technical GEEK description that was not written well or a format that was easy to understand. So I punted and tried it by installing it in the wall socket, pushed the button as stated and bang on came the green light. Someone in the company needs to make a simply visual illustration and trash all the GEEK talk because there are more non GEEKS then GEEKS. Better news - the thing fixed the reception on our cells phone. THAT WAS GREAT FOR EVERYONE! I took away one star because the instructions need to be changed.
customer_reviews.author: Treasure Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after reading many reviews, and having used NetGear products with good results. Unfortunately this Range Extender product did not meet my expectations. Now it is dead as a doornail, and since I've had it more than 90 days, my $75 dollars is kaput. While it was working it was flakey - I had to turn it off and back on about once a week. When it worked it was great. But that's over now. I really expected more. And no, I did not purchase any maintenance agreement. I'll try again with a different product. There are several new range extenders available, and they seem promising. And this time they will not be NetGear.
customer_reviews.author: SHL

customer_reviews.title: Loss of Original Siganl Quality
customer_reviews.text: This unit works and is very easy to set up. However be aware that you are cutting your signal in half when connecting to this unit. I can now receive signal were I could not but have major rebuffing issues on Netflix and You Tube in my man cave. So yes it works but expect about half your signal. The best way to overcome this signal loss is to increase your main service with your provider by double what you need.
customer_reviews.author: wd lash

customer_reviews.title: Not great at all as I had hoped, bad choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to reach just one room, den, which is only about 50 ft away from our modem in the study so we could get wifi to our internet tv. The signal was still so weak we couldn't even use it. The signal kept disappearing! Would have returned it but the window closed the day I tried. I regret buying it. It's useless to us. We have a NETGEAR wifi modem connected to our computer internet modem and the booster didn't do a thing to improve what we already have.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but speeds not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to extend the range of our xfinity wifi in our house. I positioned this on the main floor directly above the location of the xfinity modem and at best only got a download speed of about 95mbps. When I moved it slightly away the speed reduced to only about 74mbps. When I connect directly to the xfinity modem with my laptop in the same spots I get download speeds over 200mbps. The Netgear AC1200 is easy to install, but I did not get the range or speed I anticipated o either the 2G or 5G channels, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: James Mauro

customer_reviews.title: reliable signal in the area where other wifi extender failed to reach
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this product. I had used two other similar products from other brand with much higher rating in Amazon. One died within couple of months and another has weak and unstable signals. Very often the signal just drop even with light web browsing. After seeing some "not name brand" had stellar all 5-star reviews and all happened in one day, I became suspicious about the rating manipulation on Amazon. So I decided to just buy a name-brand such as Netgear. The rating for Netgear product seems more real. I was right, this product is so much better than any product I have used. It is just superior.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Zhuang

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product! I've had WiFi connection issues for literally years and it wasn't until a Direct TV guy doing a service call suggested I install a WiFi range extender. The Netgear AC1200 was what I decided on and I'm very glad I did. It costs about $20 more than the basic Netgear product and I'm sure it's money well spent. Setup was easy. It takes a few minutes for LED power Green light to illuminate after you plug it in. I used my iPad to connect to the Netgear network and it worked perfectly. Just remember that every device you have (TV, iPad, cellphone, etc.) needs to be connected to the Netgear WiFi signal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple to setup and works great
customer_reviews.text: After switching to Google Mesh Wifi, a few of my Apple HomeKit devices started acting up and since the recommendation to the disconnecting devices was to use a separate SSID for 2Ghz and 5Ghz wifi, i decided to add this wifi extender and only enable 2.4Ghz for those devices. The setup was easy and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Pyro

customer_reviews.title: Extender for my basement to connected to xFi router
customer_reviews.text: I have xFinity xFi router on the second floor, I use Netgear R7000 in the back of my house as an assess point connect by ethernet to the xFi router. This extender EX6120 I position in the basement to get better speed. WPA setup was easy and my speeds on the treadmill are above 10 Mbps now, even up to 200 Mbps more stable video viewing. Works great and cost way less than xFi pods from xFinity/Comcast
customer_reviews.author: Phil M

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Dropping Signal!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so frustrating! I bought it 4 months ago and it seemed to help at first, but now it drops connection constantly. I have a 1600sf house....my router is on the inside wall of our living room next to an L-shaped hall that goes to the back bedrooms. The extender is in that hall just 25ft from the router and the extender is is just 15ft from my back bedroom where my office is. The connections drops literally every 10-20 minutes. When it is getting a signal, it comes in strong enough. I have tried resetting my router. Pulling the extender out of the plug and back in again and Im ready to throw it away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You cant beat the price and the quality of this product! Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. For some reason my Wifi wasnt extending to parts of my house which is odd because my house isnt that big. Since the kids started doing online schooling due to Covid and were losing signal so much I decided to invest in one of these and it was the best investment I ever made. The cable company, which I'm not going to name names but we all know who they are in Florida, was trying to charge me $20 per each wifi range extender and o think also charge me monthly. You cant beat the price and the quality of this product. Thank you netgear.
customer_reviews.author: MERCY LLORENS

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Setup-Good Signal!
customer_reviews.text: So far, had it up and running in 5 minutes. I did not do WEP, just straight up extender to my network. I don't know how anyone could say it is difficult to set up. Regardless, mine was not, and it works perfectly. Resolved an issue I was having with my Tailwind IQ3 wireless connection. I do recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SJGUSMC21

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't "see" my 5ghz network!
customer_reviews.text: Initial review. This does not see my 5ghz network from my Apple Airport Extreme. I will probably keep this because it does extend my network, but it makes no sense for this to lack the ability to see both networks. This is marketed to extend both 2.4 and 5ghz networks and it does not do it! Network speed does not get close to the advertised 1200 Mbps. My network is currently capable of reaching 90 Mbps on it’s own 2.4ghz network and only reaches 34 Mbps on this extender. EX6120
customer_reviews.author: B. Good

customer_reviews.title: We had another range extender (Belkin) which ran super hot and had to be rebooted all the time
customer_reviews.text: We had another range extender (Belkin) which ran super hot and had to be rebooted all the time. Replaced with the EX6120, it runs cool and consistently, we get great range all over the house. The web software for configuring is powerful and intuitive. Wish we had purchased this excellent product in the first place. EDIT: After a year and a half, the unit kept dropping connections. More and more each day. So I'm now giving it three starts due to pretty good use for that time but it's out of warranty and I've replaced it with a TP-Link - AC1750 Wifi Range Extender which cost about the same and is preforming vastly better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this range extender for about a month now. I am loving it so far! My bedroom is an extension to our brick house, and the wifi signal has trouble reaching through that brick wall. With this extender, I don't have any problems using the wifi from my bedroom and have a full 3 bars 90% of the time! I can stream music or video or do anything else that I want with ease! It was fairly simple to set up as well. You just have to follow the instructions closely. I don't know how I ever survived without this extender before!
customer_reviews.author: Sixx6SixxTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Seems to interfere more than it helps the WiFi signal
customer_reviews.text: Lots of issues after we installed this, including the signal constantly cutting out and actually interfering with our primary WiFi router (also a NetGear product). Now, we just unplug it until we need to go outside to use it on the patio. Since unplugging it, all the issues with our main WiFi (which started as soon as we started using this) stopped.
customer_reviews.author: No Agenda, Just Facts

customer_reviews.title: Over Heats!
customer_reviews.text: I have two Netgear Routers which work great; however, this extender is a different story. It over heats just about to the point of not being able to handle. Also the documentation included for installation does not agree with Netgear website for installing using a web browser. I had to use the manual process for the install. Very disappointed with this Netgear product. I returned it!
customer_reviews.author: ENTITLED2OPINION

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I watched the installation video and followed the manual but a very important step is omitted in both. Once you connect to the router with the WPS you're not finished. Then you must connect to Netgear wifi source and pair it up to your existing wifi signal. Once I figured that out it seems to work . But I just installed it today so we will see if it continues to solve my connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Huttoite

customer_reviews.title: Really worked!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as we live in the country and our WiFi is super slow and very limited on range. When I installed this, which was very easy to do, it increased our speed to where we could actually watch a movie on Netflix and it didn't keep having to stop to 'load' the movie. Not lightening speed, but we knew that going in, just happy for the increased speed and range we were able to get
customer_reviews.author: JMU

customer_reviews.title: Order a new one if you must
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 "reconditioned." They all had multiple product fault/s. The wifi light would not light on one, two ran hot to the touch,(scary) The original I bought was new and worked fine. I didn't call tech support because they were easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Into the Past

customer_reviews.title: Installation might be tricky
customer_reviews.text: It might be a good product but I had significant trouble dealing with it. In the process of installation my computer I got hacked. A lot of wasted time now to recover. I thought the attached booklet instructed me to login to mywifi.net, but Netgear says it should have been mywifiext.net. Be cautious accepting help online from potential hackers claiming to represent Netgear technical support. I returned the unit along with the booklet. So I cannot verify if I made the mistake. After the damage is already done, Netgear got back to me having received my complaint, which I appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Jutelander

customer_reviews.title: Really Works
customer_reviews.text: I had another one of these upstairs in our house to help streaming Amazon Prime videos on our bedroom tv which is not located near our router. I was losing wifi signal on my phone on our porch, which is further from our router in the other direction. So I bought another one and plugged it in near our porch. It installed itself and began working. I didn't have to do anything but enjoy the stronger wifi signal on our porch. I gave 5 stars to Tech Support but haven't needed to call them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Price

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money or time.
customer_reviews.text: No, I would not recommend this product at all. First the set up cost me $200 for tech support (not Netgear), second, the boost signal is sub-par and not worth the price paid. Interestingly I have a NetGear wireless router as well and it sucks. It offers the 2 & 5 gtz signal but this does not improve product performance. I will never by NetGear products again.
customer_reviews.author: Leo 75

customer_reviews.title: East to Install & It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the NETGEAR WiFi Range Extender EX6120 (Coverage up to 1200 sq.ft.) primarily to extend my WIFI zone in order for my Ring doorbell to get better signal. Set up was easy overall and my Ring doorbell now has much better signal. I noticed the dead zone at the far end of my house is now getting a much stronger WIFI signal. Overall, I am happy with thus product especially since it cost $40.00 and was super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Westernspeed

customer_reviews.title: provides about 25ft of distance
customer_reviews.text: not worth the price. anything past 25 feet and signal strength too weak. i use this on an xfinity router and to link is about 50ft from it. if i stand about 20ft from the tp link it will work but anything past that is problematic. it was dirt easy to setup. plug into wall. press wps button on it than router. done. but it clearly does not deliver on the range distance it claims
customer_reviews.author: John Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Works great but directions are confusing.  Only reason I gave it a 3.
customer_reviews.text: Reason I only gave it a 3 was because of the directions. Not only do they label the buttons wrong but they jump all over the place. It would be easier to understand if you just stuck to directions in sequence of how to do things correctly and then follow that with the instructions you give. All the stopping to refer to page 6 or 9 is confusing. I finally just winged it and got it hooked up. Once it was connected, it worked fabulously! Signal reaches out to the far corner of my back yard. So, fix the directions and I could give you a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D. Lego

customer_reviews.title: Great Extender; Speeds Tripled!!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an outdated extender that was no longer working. I followed the instructions and paired this to my rounter with wps, which was super simple. It created 2 networks that mimic my current SSIDs except with an 2G-EXT and 5G-EXT added to the end. Speed has more than tripled in the far corner of our house where we used to only get 10-20 mbps, now we are seeing 70-90 mbps.don't know if signal has increased but speed has really helped when trying to play the ps4 online. Our problem was the rooms past the plumbing (2 bathrooms and kitchen) were getting tons of interference.This extender seems to really help.
customer_reviews.author: FriscoPops

customer_reviews.title: Does almost nothing.
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the worst device created by man. It was able to extend my existing network by about four feet. After that, the signal was just as bad as using the main router. Sometimes I got a stronger signal from the main router than when I was standing right next to this thing. Then when it was working, it seemed like it struggled to actually provide the internet connection. It said it was connected, but specified “no internet connection” If your goal is to get your WiFi into the backyard or the other side of your house, this probably isn’t the device.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: wanted this to work, but failed miserably
customer_reviews.text: setup started well and I was expecting great things, but for use as a wifi extender with the same SSID as your main router it is terrible. The only way it would work was if the device had a separate SSID and then it did an excellent job. If you are trying to mesh with this, look somewhere else. Also the device does not like the use of special characters in the WIFI password.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Too Slow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover a dead spot where my kids were doing virtual learning. Though I configured it for "Fastlane" and the signal strength was usually strong, the data speeds were about 20 Mbps slower. It didn't solve my kids' dropout problem and they preferred connecting to the router's WiFi network. Bought a Netgear Orbi system instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jam Meister

customer_reviews.title: Not Spectrum friendly
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with spectrum - 4 hours of trying. Even after doing factory reset, laptop can see it in network manager, but it won't connect to spectrum router with wps button pushing on both. Instructions followed, support site solutions attempted, complaint site posts tried. Should have read non-amazon reviews before buying. Many people experience problem, and even after hours of dealing with spectrum support calls, they quit in frustration. I've done that before, and life's too short to waste another 3 hours of "phone customer service".
customer_reviews.author: Syzygus

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I put this half way between my bedroom and router, and the router signal is stronger then the boosters signal. This is only good for boosting weak signals in a weak manner, you will get extra distance from your WiFi, but it will be slow and unreliable. If I put the booster close enough to the wifi to get a perfect signal, then put distance between me and booster(which is between me and router), the boosters signal will drop off before the routers(even though it is closer). Just don't buy this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Deric L. Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Extends for sure, but may loose speed
customer_reviews.text: This extender was definitely helpful when i had my old NETGEAR C3700 router/modem. A couple days after buying this extender I got the NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 and decided to run the XFINITY speed test and as you can see from the attached photos, there is def a difference. I can't say its helping extend with my new router since well it's new and the wifi signal is great in the house, but with my old C3700 it definitely extended where I would only get say 2 bars of signal strength in one room was then at the full 3 bars with the extender.
customer_reviews.author: cperez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth extra $
customer_reviews.text: I knew this product was a return/refurbished model, but still it came with absolutely no instructions. Turns out this product did not easily set up with my Netgear Nighthawk Router; it took a couple hours of effort and content googling for more instructions at each impasse. Now that it’s set up it does seem to be working well, but the range is very limited and not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install is 3.5 Stars.
customer_reviews.text: These work well. The first install was easy. I bought a new router and the second install was a total pain despite the new router having the same passwords etc. They kept dropping the router. I followed the instructions for re-setting and had to do that twice. They do what they are purchased to do: extend the wifi. I have not done a speed test and do not see a speed issue, especially noticing the faster wifi I get with them compared to what I was getting in those rooms.
customer_reviews.author: TheBob

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to register on my network with ASUS router
customer_reviews.text: Tried with Ethernet, WPS, Browser setup, and could never get the extender to register on my ASUS router. Spent a good amount of time repeating steps from manual, troubleshooting different ethernet cables and locations in the house, and variations of the steps, and Googling for help, but the extender was never discovered by any of my devices and could not get on the network.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't link up and cuts download speed in half - would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: These range extenders do not sync up/link up with my other Netgear router and they actually cut the download speed in half I've read and was confirmed by several IT consultants....there are better node type range extenders/boosters out there to use. Couldn't get good tech support on the product so I called Best Buy for answers.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Niber

customer_reviews.title: Not a good solution to my problem
customer_reviews.text: I battled with poor wifi coverage in my condo for years. I tried getting a new router and a new modem and that didnt help. So I tried this Extender. It was pretty to set up. But it would lose connectivity constantly. I reset it all the time and after almost a year of trying to chalk the problems up to other devices, I ended up buying a new Amplifi mesh router. The Amplifi router was on the expensive side but totally worth it. Bottom line: dont bother with this Extender. Its a piece of junk. Looking back I wish I would have just returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago PrimeMember

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it works
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi Range Extender works pretty good. I am using in my detached garage to extend the WiFi range of my router in the house. The distance between the two is about 30 feet with a concrete wall and framed garage in the way. From the garage I have a workshop in the rear of the garage that is partitioned from the main garage area. I can use link up with the extender from the shop but can't go much further. It does what I want it to do. I'd recommend it. I also have a WiFi camera in the shop which uses this extender.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Boler

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy setup and works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: First I spent extra to get this here faster because I was so fed up with our internet troubles. Charter Spectrum said we had great speed but every day we would love service in the back bedroom with our phones and/or TV. I couldn't cut cable until I got this resolved. The extender came in great simple packaging. The video at the bottom of the product's amazon page on how to set it up was super simple to follow and I had no issues at all setting it up. The network strength is the bedroom went from fair/poor/non-existent to very good!!! Thank you for a simple product!
customer_reviews.author: Seatonsmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service and Seller Service
customer_reviews.text: Great Customer Service and Seller Service but that's where it stops. The product didn't work at all. After hours trying on my own and with Custormer Support, even they said, just return it and get another device. The seller was awesome and the product arrived quickly but it just didn't work. It's not their fault so don't hold it against them.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Williams

customer_reviews.title: Installation kept crashing
customer_reviews.text: Walked through the set up several times, and near the end of the 'Genie' installation the thing would just dump, and never finish the setup. I would have a wifi access point but no connectivity to the router. I even tried doing the wired deal and set it up as a separate access point, but the setup would crash. So, I sent it back. I have a pretty simple setup with the FiOS Actiontec Quantum Router, and pretty much a standard set up. Searching tech support was too much of a headache. I can set up and bridge a cheaper WAP myself.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R. Bilbro

customer_reviews.title: Didn't extend itself far enough
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I expected too much from this WiFi extender. It was a little confusing to setup, webpage for setup wouldn't load properly and directions weren't really that clear. I think they could have done a better job in explaining how to set up the extender. Once I got the extender setup, it was really just ok ... it did extend the range of my WiFi but not all that much more ... I was at maybe 2-3 bars without it and 3-4 bars with it ... I don't think I'd recommend this product ... thanks!
customer_reviews.author: JKS

product_meta.title: NETGEAR WiFi Range Extender EX6120 - Coverage up to 1200 sq.ft. and 20 devices with AC1200 Dual Band Wireless Signal Booster & Repeater (up to 1200Mbps speed), and Compact Wall Plug Design
product_meta.description: Model:WiFi Extender AC1200NETGEAR AC1200 WiFi Range Extender, Ethernet Port, Works with any WiFi Router (EX6120). Ease of Use: CD-less setup—great for mobile devices,Push ‘N’ Connect using Wi-Fi Protected Setup(WPS)1.
feature_bullets: Extended wireless coverage: Adds WiFi range coverage up to 1200 square feet, and connects up to 20 devices such as laptops, smartphones, speakers, IP cameras, tablets, IoT devices, and more
AC1200 WIFI speed: Provides up to 1200Mbps performance using dual band and patented FastLane(TM) technology for video streaming and casual gaming

Universal compatibility: works with any wireless router, gateway, or cable modem with wifi. System requirements - 2.4 and/or 5ghz 802.11ac & b/g/n wireless router or gateway , microsoft internet explorer 8.0, firefox 20, safari 5.1, or google chrome 25.0 browsers or higher
Wired ethernet port: Simply plug in game consoles, streaming players, or other nearby wired devices using the one 10/100M port for maximum speed
Safe & secure: Supports WEP and WPA/WPA2 wireless security protocols
Simple to setup: Press the WPS button to connect to your router. Use the NETGEAR WiFi Analyzer app for optimal location

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars8,441 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
